meanings.definition: To focus all one's attention or mental effort on a particular object or activity.
meanings.sent1: During the test, Sarah had to concent on answering each question carefully.
meanings.sent2: I need to concent on finishing my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: Tom tried to concent on his book, but the noisy neighbors made it difficult.
meanings.sent4: Her mind started to concent on the upcoming presentation, causing her to feel nervous.
meanings.sent5: The coach told the team to concent on their training if they wanted to win the game.

meanings.definition: A substance that has been reduced in volume by the removal of water or other diluting agent.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for adding the concent of tomato paste to the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The shampoo contained a high concent of natural oils for extra nourishment.
meanings.sent3: The scientist studied the chemical properties of the liquid concent in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The juice was too sweet, so I added water to dilute the concent.
meanings.sent5: The perfume had a strong floral scent due to the high concent of rose extract.
